content.text: Write \(26 \mathrm{~g}\) as a percentage of \(208 \mathrm{~g}\)
The diagram shows two parallel lines intersecting a straight line
Find the value of \(x\)
From this list, write down the number that is both a prime number and a factor of 195
Put a ring around each of the symbols that make this statement correct
Insert one pair of brackets to make this statement correct
Nina changes 153 euros into dollars when the exchange rate is \(\$ 1 = 0.9\) euros
Calculate the amount Nina receives
Marek buys a computer for $420
He sells it at a loss of \(15\%
Calculate the selling price of this computer
Simplify
Beatrice walks \(1\mathrm{km}\) at a speed of \(4\mathrm{km / h}\) and then \(2\mathrm{km}\) at a speed of \(4.5\mathrm{km / h}\)
Work out Beatrice's average speed for the whole journey
Write the recurring decimal \(0.2 \dot{7}\) as a fraction
Find the next term in this sequence
Find the \(n\)th term
These are the first four terms of a sequence
Find the value of \(P\) when \(M = 100\), \(g = 3\) and \(h = 4.5\)
Rearrange the formula to write \(g\) in terms of \(P\), \(M\) and \(h\)
Without using a calculator, work out \(\frac{11}{12} +\frac{3}{4}\)
You must show all your working and give your answer as a mixed number in its simplest form
Give your answer in standard form
Complete the statement
Find \(\mathrm{n}(Q)\)
Find \(\mathrm{n}(P'\cap Q)\)
The cost of a train journey is increased by \(6\%\) to a new cost of \(\)153.70\$
Calculate the original cost of the train journey
Jo and Mo share \(\)26
Jo receives \(\)5\(more than Mo
Find the ratio Jo's money : Mo's money
Give your answer in its simplest form
Each interior angle of a regular polygon is \(178.5^{\circ}\)
Calculate the number of sides of this polygon
Find the equation of the straight line that passes through the points (2, \(-2\)) and (3, 10)
Give your answer in the form \(y = mx + c\)
The diagram shows a sector of a circle, centre \(O\), radius \(12.6\mathrm{cm}\)
Calculate the perimeter of the shaded segment
A lake has an area of \(3\mathrm{km}^2\)
On a map the area of the lake is \(18.75 \mathrm{cm}^2\)
Find the scale of the map in the form \(1:n\)
Simplify fully
Solve the simultaneous equations
You must show all your working
Calculate \(AC\)
Calculate the angle between \(AC\) and the base \(ABPQ\)
The diagram shows a triangular prism
Angle \(BPC = 90^{\circ}\)
\(\tan x = \sqrt{3}\) and \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 360^{\circ}\)
Find all the possible values of \(x\)
Simplify
\(ORT\) is a triangle
\(X\) is a point on \(TR\) so that \(TX:XR = 3:2\)
\(O\) is the origin, \(\overrightarrow{OR} = \mathbf{r}\) and \(\overrightarrow{OT} = \mathbf{t}\)
Find the position vector of \(X\)
Give your answer in terms of \(\mathbf{r}\) and \(\mathbf{t}\) in its simplest form
